title: Sivan Fahima
text:
Sivan Fahima (or Pahima, ; born 7 September 1983) is an Israeli <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player. She plays as a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a> for the Israeli national team. She had also played in for <a href="Maccabi%20Holon%20F.C.%20%28women%29">Maccabi Holon</a> in the <a href="2003%E2%80%9304%20UEFA%20Women%27s%20Cup">2003–04 UEFA Women's Cup</a>.
Club career.
Fahima started her career in <a href="Maccabi%20Haifa%20F.C.%20%28women%29">Maccabi Haifa</a> until the team folded in 2003 and Fahima transferred to <a href="Maccabi%20Holon%20F.C.%20%28women%29">Maccabi Holon</a>, where she played until 2014, when she moved to <a href="F.C.%20Kiryat%20Gat%20%28women%29">F.C. Kiryat Gat</a>.
Throughout her career, Fahima won 6 <a href="Ligat%20Nashim">championships</a> and 11 <a href="Israeli%20Women%27s%20Cup">cups</a>, scoring a total of six goals in cup finals, including a hat-trick in <a href="2008%E2%80%9309%20Israeli%20Women%27s%20Cup">2009 cup final</a>. Fahima was joint top scorer in the <a href="2012%E2%80%9313%20Israeli%20Women%27s%20Cup">2012–13 cup</a>, scoring 4 goals throughout the competition.
International career.
Fahima made her international debut for <a href="Israel%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Israel women's national football team</a> in 2001 against <a href="Estonia%20women%27s%20football%20team">Estonia</a> and played a total of 19 matches for the national team, scoring two goals. Fahima's last match was on 26 August 2007, also against Estonia. Fahima also played for <a href="Israel%20women%27s%20national%20under-19%20football%20team">the U-19 national team</a>, making six appearances and scoring two goals, all during <a href="2002%20UEFA%20Women%27s%20Under-19%20Championship">2002 UEFA Women's Under-19 Championship</a> qualifying tournament.
